cards.name: Lava Spike
cards.text: Lava Spike deals 3 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: Some kami attacks during the war were rife with trickery, subterfuge, and subtlety, draining hope and pride from the mortal world. Other attacks were a lot more straightforward.
cards.originalText: Lava Spike deals 3 damage to target player.

cards.name: Mana Seism
cards.text: Sacrifice any number of lands, then add that much {C}.
cards.flavor:
"It is the nature of humanity not to worry about tomorrow, especially when there's a good chance they won't live to see the end of today."
—Kiku, Night's Flower
cards.originalText: Sacrifice any number of lands. Add {1} to your mana pool for each land sacrificed this way.

cards.name: Mindblaze
cards.text: Choose a nonland card name and a number greater than 0. Target player reveals their library. If that library contains exactly the chosen number of cards with the chosen name, Mindblaze deals 8 damage to that player. Then that player shuffles their library.
cards.originalText: Name a nonland card and choose a number greater than 0. Target player reveals his or her library. If that library contains exactly the chosen number of the named card, Mindblaze deals 8 damage to that player. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Myojin of Infinite Rage
cards.text:
Myojin of Infinite Rage enters the battlefield with a divinity counter on it if you cast it from your hand.
Myojin of Infinite Rage has indestructible as long as it has a divinity counter on it.
Remove a divinity counter from Myojin of Infinite Rage: Destroy all lands.

rulings.text: In a Commander game where this card is your commander, casting it from the Command zone does not count as casting it from your hand.

cards.originalText:
Myojin of Infinite Rage comes into play with a divinity counter on it if you played it from your hand.
Myojin of Infinite Rage is indestructible as long as it has a divinity counter on it.
Remove a divinity counter from Myojin of Infinite Rage: Destroy all lands.

cards.name: Ore Gorger
cards.text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may destroy target nonbasic land.
cards.flavor:
"We've stumbled upon a network of caves not on our maps. We can only hope it is safe to spend the night."
—Lost Battalion, message to General Takeno
cards.originalText: Whenever you play a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may destroy target nonbasic land.

cards.name: Pain Kami
cards.text: {X}{R}, Sacrifice Pain Kami: It deals X damage to target creature.
cards.flavor:
"All kami are our enemies now,
A very tough lesson to learn.
But it's one that's taken quickly,
When you feel what it's like to burn"
—Ku-Ku, akki poet
cards.originalText: {X}{R}, Sacrifice Pain Kami: Pain Kami deals X damage to target creature.

cards.name: Ronin Houndmaster
cards.text:
Haste
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
cards.flavor: Some samurai fell so far out of grace that only dogs would keep them company.
cards.originalText:
Haste
Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

cards.name: Ryusei, the Falling Star
cards.text:
Flying
When Ryusei, the Falling Star dies, it deals 5 damage to each creature without flying.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Ryusei, the Falling Star is put into a graveyard from play, it deals 5 damage to each creature without flying.

cards.name: Shimatsu the Bloodcloaked
cards.text: As Shimatsu the Bloodcloaked enters the battlefield, sacrifice any number of permanents. Shimatsu enters the battlefield with that many +1/+1 counters on it.
cards.flavor: Their dominion over dark and destructive forces twisted the oni into beings of pure malevolence.

rulings.text: You sacrifice the permanents before Shimatsu enters the battlefield, so you can't sacrifice any creatures that enter the battlefield at the same time it does.

cards.originalText: As Shimatsu the Bloodcloaked comes into play, sacrifice any number of permanents. Shimatsu comes into play with that many +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.name: Sideswipe
cards.text: You may change any targets of target Arcane spell.
cards.flavor: Hisoka's wizards struggled for years to master the art of redirection that came so naturally to the shamans of Ganzan Pass.
cards.originalText: You may change any targets of target Arcane spell.

cards.name: Sokenzan Bruiser
cards.text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.flavor:
"We camped near the Sokenzan Mountains. Though I know its inhabitants are sparse, I hear cries coming from the highest peaks every night, as if the mountains themselves bellow for vengeance."
—Lost Battalion, message to General Takeno
cards.originalText: Mountainwalk

cards.name: Soul of Magma
cards.text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, Soul of Magma deals 1 damage to target creature.
cards.flavor:
"In every other mind, the battle was lost. General Takeno alone was not touched by despair. Drawing his blade, he was attack and rallying cry in one."
—Battle of Akagi River: A Survivor's Tale
cards.originalText: Whenever you play a Spirit or Arcane spell, Soul of Magma deals 1 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Soulblast
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice all creatures you control.
Soulblast deals damage to any target equal to the total power of the sacrificed creatures.
cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to play Soulblast, sacrifice all creatures you control.
Soulblast deals damage to target creature or player equal to the total power of the sacrificed creatures.

cards.name: Stone Rain
cards.text: Destroy target land.
cards.flavor:
"The kami struck with gouts of fire, showers of rock, and the combined rage of the spirit world. Only Eiganjo Castle remained standing, glistening untouched in the sun."
—The History of Kamigawa
cards.originalText: Destroy target land.

cards.name: Strange Inversion
cards.text:
Switch target creature's power and toughness until end of turn.
Splice onto Arcane {1}{R} (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

rulings.text: Effects that switch power and toughness apply after all other effects that change power and/or toughness, regardless of which effect was created first.
Switching a creature's power and toughness twice (or any even number of times) effectively returns the creature to the power and toughness it had before any switches.
You reveal all cards you intend to splice at the same time. Each individual card can be spliced only once onto any one spell.
A card with a splice ability can't be spliced onto itself because the spell is on the stack (and not in your hand) when you reveal the cards you want to splice onto it.

You choose all targets for the spell after revealing cards you want to splice, including any targets required by the text of any of those cards. You may choose a different target for each instance of the word "target" on the resulting spell.
If all of the spell's targets are illegal when the spell tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen.

cards.originalText:
Switch target creature's power and toughness until end of turn.
Splice onto Arcane {1}{R} (As you play an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

cards.name: Through the Breach
cards.text:
You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. That creature gains haste. Sacrifice that creature at the beginning of the next end step.
Splice onto Arcane {2}{R}{R} (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

rulings.text: Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional. When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.
You reveal all cards you intend to splice at the same time. Each individual card can be spliced only once onto any one spell.
A card with a splice ability can't be spliced onto itself because the spell is on the stack (and not in your hand) when you reveal the cards you want to splice onto it.

You choose all targets for the spell after revealing cards you want to splice, including any targets required by the text of any of those cards. You may choose a different target for each instance of the word "target" on the resulting spell.
If all of the spell's targets are illegal when the spell tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen.

cards.originalText:
Put a creature card from your hand into play. That creature has haste. Sacrifice that creature at end of turn.
Splice onto Arcane {2}{R}{R} (As you play an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

cards.name: Tide of War
cards.text: Whenever one or more creatures block, flip a coin. If you win the flip, each blocking creature is sacrificed by its controller. If you lose the flip, each blocked creature is sacrificed by its controller.

rulings.text: Tide of War's ability triggers only once each combat and only if at least one blocker is declared. The effect does nothing to unblocked attacking creatures.
Tide of War's controller always flips the coin. This means that you want to win the flip when you're attacking but lose the flip when you're defending.
Even if the blockers are sacrificed, any attackers that were blocked are still considered blocked.

cards.originalText: Whenever one or more creatures blocks, flip a coin. If you win the flip, the defending player sacrifices all blocking creatures. Otherwise, the attacking player sacrifices the blocked creatures.

cards.name: Uncontrollable Anger
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and attacks each combat if able.
cards.flavor: To an akki warrior, gravity is the direction of the nearest unsmashed face.
cards.originalText:
You may play Uncontrollable Anger any time you could play an instant.
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and attacks each turn if able.

cards.name: Unearthly Blizzard
cards.text: Up to three target creatures can't block this turn.
cards.flavor:
"We are trapped. The mountains and blinding kami storms have made us hopelessly lost. We are starving. In the name of all things sacred, please, send help . . . ."
—Lost Battalion, final message to General Takeno
cards.originalText: Up to three target creatures can't block this turn.

cards.name: Unnatural Speed
cards.text: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"How can we hope to match the speed of lightning? The fury of storms? The power of mountains? The answer is simple. We cannot. I advise against this war."
—Sensei Hisoka, letter to Lord Konda
cards.originalText: Target creature gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Yamabushi's Flame
cards.text: Yamabushi's Flame deals 3 damage to any target. If a creature dealt damage this way would die this turn, exile it instead.
cards.originalText: Yamabushi's Flame deals 3 damage to target creature or player. If a creature dealt damage this way would be put into a graveyard this turn, remove it from the game instead.

cards.name: Yamabushi's Storm
cards.text: Yamabushi's Storm deals 1 damage to each creature. If a creature dealt damage this way would die this turn, exile it instead.
cards.originalText: Yamabushi's Storm deals 1 damage to each creature. If a creature dealt damage this way would be put into a graveyard this turn, remove it from the game instead.

cards.name: Zo-Zu the Punisher
cards.text: Whenever a land enters the battlefield, Zo-Zu the Punisher deals 2 damage to that land's controller.
cards.flavor:
"He can cause a lot of pain and do it with no fuss. That's all good, but I just wish he didn't do it to us"
—Ku-Ku, akki poet
cards.originalText: Whenever a land comes into play, Zo-Zu the Punisher deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

cards.name: Azusa, Lost but Seeking
cards.text: You may play two additional lands on each of your turns.
cards.flavor: "I do not miss Jukai Forest. It is not my home. My home is Kamigawa, its people my family. Wherever I set my pack and rest my head, I am home."

rulings.text: Azusa's ability is cumulative with other effects that allow you to play additional lands, such as that of Wayward Swordtooth (from the Rivals of Ixalan set).

cards.originalText: You may play two additional lands on each of your turns.

cards.name: Budoka Gardener
cards.text: {T}: You may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield. If you control ten or more lands, flip Budoka Gardener.

rulings.text: Budoka Gardener flips if you control ten or more lands when its ability resolves, even if you don't use its ability to put a land onto the battlefield.

Budoka Gardener flips even if you put a second copy of a legendary land onto the battlefield. You'll have ten lands on the battlefield while the ability is resolving, so the Gardener flips. Then you will choose one of the legendary lands to keep and put the other into its owner's graveyard as a state-based action.

cards.originalText: {T}: You may put a land card from your hand into play. If you control ten or more lands, flip Budoka Gardener.

cards.name: Dokai, Weaver of Life
cards.text: {4}{G}{G}, {T}: Create an X/X green Elemental creature token, where X is the number of lands you control.
cards.originalText: {T}: You may put a land card from your hand into play. If you control ten or more lands, flip Budoka Gardener.

cards.name: Burr Grafter
cards.text:
Sacrifice Burr Grafter: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
Soulshift 3 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)
cards.originalText:
Sacrifice Burr Grafter: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
Soulshift 3 (When this is put into a graveyard from play, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

cards.name: Commune with Nature
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal a creature card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

rulings.text: If you don't reveal a creature card, put all the revealed cards on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.originalText: Look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal a creature card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Dosan the Falling Leaf
cards.text: Players can cast spells only during their own turns.
cards.flavor:
"Each night as Master Dosan prays to the kami, the hate he receives in return withers his body a little more. Though the kami are slowly killing him, still he continues his prayers."
—Meditation journal of a young budoka

rulings.text: Dosan's ability only stops players from casting spells. It doesn't stop activated or triggered abilities.

cards.originalText: Players can play spells only during their own turns.

cards.name: Dripping-Tongue Zubera
cards.text: When Dripping-Tongue Zubera dies, create a 1/1 colorless Spirit creature token for each Zubera that died this turn.
cards.flavor: When the Honden of Life's Web was destroyed, its attendants swarmed Kamigawa to ensure mortal defeat.
cards.originalText: When Dripping-Tongue Zubera is put into a graveyard from play, put a 1/1 colorless Spirit creature token into play for each Zubera put into a graveyard from play this turn.

cards.name: Feast of Worms
cards.text: Destroy target land. If that land was legendary, its controller sacrifices another land.
cards.flavor:
"The dust beneath our feet was once part of a mighty civilization. Shall we too provide the path for a future generation?"
—Sensei Golden-Tail
cards.originalText: Destroy target land. If that land is legendary, its controller sacrifices another land.

cards.name: Feral Deceiver
cards.text:
{1}: Look at the top card of your library.
{2}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it's a land card, Feral Deceiver gets +2/+2 and gains trample until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.originalText:
{1}: Look at the top card of your library.
{2}: Reveal the top card of your library. If it's a land, Feral Deceiver gets +2/+2 and gains trample until end of turn. Play this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Gale Force
cards.text: Gale Force deals 5 damage to each creature with flying.
cards.flavor: Everything the kami had done, they did with more force. Gentle breezes became typhoons, rolling rivers turned to crushing rapids, and gentle growth became overnight masses of thorns and vines.
cards.originalText: Gale Force deals 5 damage to each creature with flying.

cards.name: Glimpse of Nature
cards.text: Whenever you cast a creature spell this turn, draw a card.
cards.flavor: Dosan sat in repose for many hours. He made no motion, no sound at all. And as he sat, nature revealed itself to him.
cards.originalText: Whenever you play a creature spell this turn, draw a card.

cards.name: Hana Kami
cards.text: {1}{G}, Sacrifice Hana Kami: Return target Arcane card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: It grew in lands lit by pride and watered by tears.
cards.originalText: {1}{G}, Sacrifice Hana Kami: Return target Arcane card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Heartbeat of Spring
cards.text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, that player adds one mana of any type that land produced.
cards.flavor:
"It is true that we monks hold the key to paradise, but most don't understand that the paradise we guard is the one within."
—Diary of Azusa
cards.originalText: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, that player adds one mana of that type to his or her mana pool.

cards.name: Honden of Life's Web
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, create a 1/1 colorless Spirit creature token for each Shrine you control.
cards.flavor: To the sorrow of all, its web became a net that strangled those who helped weave it.

foreignNames.name: Honden de la Toile de vie

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a 1/1 colorless Spirit creature token into play for each Shrine you control.

cards.name: Humble Budoka
cards.text: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor: Each time wanderers entered the forest seeking enlightenment, Dosan was there, waiting for them to arrive.
cards.originalText: Humble Budoka can't be the target of spells or abilities.

cards.name: Iname, Life Aspect
cards.text: When Iname, Life Aspect dies, you may exile it. If you do, return any number of target Spirit cards from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Iname rejoices in the dawn of a new life, but soon becomes jealous of the simple joys denied him by his station. So the cycle begins anew.

rulings.text: The targets of Iname, Life Aspect's ability are chosen when the ability is put onto the stack, but you don't choose whether to exile Iname, Life Aspect until the ability resolves.
You may target Iname, Life Aspect. However, this doesn't do anything since the card will no longer be in your graveyard when the creature cards are returned to your hand.
You can exile the card even if you choose no targets.

In a Commander game, you may send Iname to the Command Zone instead of exiling it during the resolution of its ability. If you do, its ability still works. Iname's ability only requires that you attempted to exile it, not that it actually gets to the exile zone. This is similar to how destroying a creature (with, for example, Rest in Peace) doesn't necessarily ensure that creature will end up in the graveyard; it just so happens that the action of exiling something and the exile zone both use the same word: "exile".

cards.originalText: When Iname, Life Aspect is put into a graveyard from play, you may remove Iname, Life Aspect from the game. If you do, return any number of target Spirit cards from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Joyous Respite
cards.text: You gain 1 life for each land you control.
cards.flavor:
"I have been gifted by the kami with long life. So far, they have not seen fit to withdraw their gift. There may yet be a way to stop the killing without more blood, human or kami, being spilled."
—Dosan the Falling Leaf
cards.originalText: You gain 1 life for each land you control.

cards.name: Jugan, the Rising Star
cards.text:
Flying
When Jugan, the Rising Star dies, you may distribute five +1/+1 counters among any number of target creatures.

rulings.text: You choose how many targets Jugan's triggered ability has and how the counters are distributed as you put the ability onto the stack. Each target must receive at least one counter.

If some of the creatures are illegal targets as Jugan's triggered ability tries to resolve, the original distribution of counters still applies and the counters that would have been put on the illegal targets are lost. They won't be put instead on a legal target.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Jugan, the Rising Star is put into a graveyard from play, you may distribute five +1/+1 counters among any number of target creatures.

cards.name: Jukai Messenger
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor: Dosan's monks, deep in spiritual thought, could walk through the thickest of forests without leaving a mark, even the leaves beneath their feet unaffected by their passing.
cards.originalText: Forestwalk

cards.name: Kami of the Hunt
cards.text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, Kami of the Hunt gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Don't worry, Jiro. The kami would never attack us this close to home . . . . Jiro?"
—Hoto, temple guardian, last words
cards.originalText: Whenever you play a Spirit or Arcane spell, Kami of the Hunt gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Kashi-Tribe Reaver
cards.text:
Whenever Kashi-Tribe Reaver deals combat damage to a creature, tap that creature and it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
{1}{G}: Regenerate Kashi-Tribe Reaver.
cards.originalText:
Whenever Kashi-Tribe Reaver deals combat damage to a creature, tap that creature and it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
{1}{G}: Regenerate Kashi-Tribe Reaver.

cards.name: Kashi-Tribe Warriors
cards.text: Whenever Kashi-Tribe Warriors deals combat damage to a creature, tap that creature and it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
cards.flavor: The orochi and the monks had always had an unspoken agreement: live and let live. But when the kami began raging, some warrior youths began questioning that agreement.
cards.originalText: Whenever Kashi-Tribe Warriors deals combat damage to a creature, tap that creature and it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.name: Kodama of the North Tree
cards.text:
Trample
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor:
"The monks of the North Tree rarely saw their kodama until the Kami War, when it woke like a slumbering, angry bear."
—"Poem of the Five Trees"
cards.originalText:
Trample
Kodama of the North Tree can't be the target of spells or abilities.

cards.name: Kodama of the South Tree
cards.text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, each other creature you control gets +1/+1 and gains trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The monks of the South Tree had always reveled beneath their kodama's friendly gaze. During the Kami War, this gaze became fierce and full of hate."
—"Poem of the Five Trees"
cards.originalText: Whenever you play a Spirit or Arcane spell, each other creature you control gets +1/+1 and gains trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Kodama's Might
cards.text:
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
Splice onto Arcane {G} (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

rulings.text: You reveal all cards you intend to splice at the same time. Each individual card can be spliced only once onto any one spell.
A card with a splice ability can't be spliced onto itself because the spell is on the stack (and not in your hand) when you reveal the cards you want to splice onto it.

You choose all targets for the spell after revealing cards you want to splice, including any targets required by the text of any of those cards. You may choose a different target for each instance of the word "target" on the resulting spell.
If all of the spell's targets are illegal when the spell tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen.

cards.originalText:
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
Splice onto Arcane {G} (As you play an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

cards.name: Kodama's Reach
cards.text: Search your library for up to two basic land cards, reveal those cards, and put one onto the battlefield tapped and the other into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor:
"The land grows only where the kami will it."
—Dosan the Falling Leaf

rulings.text: You can get just one basic land card if you wish (or even none at all). If you get only one land card, you put it onto the battlefield tapped.

cards.originalText: Search your library for two basic land cards, reveal those cards, and put one into play tapped and the other into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Lure
cards.text:
Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.
cards.flavor: Jukai Forest was known for its secrets, which drew in many wayfarers and wizards. But it was those same secrets that kept most of those seekers from ever being heard from again.

rulings.text: Lure doesn't give any creatures the ability to block the target creature. It just forces those creatures that are already able to block the creature to do so.

As blockers are declared, any creature that's tapped or affected by a spell or ability that says it can't block doesn't block. If there's a cost associated with having the creature block, no player is forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't block if that cost isn't paid.

cards.originalText: All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.

cards.name: Matsu-Tribe Decoy
cards.text:
{2}{G}: Target creature blocks Matsu-Tribe Decoy this turn if able.
Whenever Matsu-Tribe Decoy deals combat damage to a creature, tap that creature and it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
cards.originalText:
{2}{G}: Target creature blocks Matsu-Tribe Decoy this turn if able.
Whenever Matsu-Tribe Decoy deals combat damage to a creature, tap that creature and it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.name: Moss Kami
cards.text: Trample
cards.flavor: Kami manifest in the form of whatever they embody in the physical plane. Some tower in the shape of moss or bark, while others take forms beyond mortal imagining.
cards.originalText: Trample

cards.name: Myojin of Life's Web
cards.text:
Myojin of Life's Web enters the battlefield with a divinity counter on it if you cast it from your hand.
Myojin of Life's Web has indestructible as long as it has a divinity counter on it.
Remove a divinity counter from Myojin of Life's Web: Put any number of creature cards from your hand onto the battlefield.

rulings.text: In a Commander game where this card is your commander, casting it from the Command zone does not count as casting it from your hand.

foreignNames.name: Myojin de la Toile de vie

cards.originalText:
Myojin of Life's Web comes into play with a divinity counter on it if you played it from your hand.
Myojin of Life's Web is indestructible as long as it has a divinity counter on it.
Remove a divinity counter from Myojin of Life's Web: Put any number of creature cards from your hand into play.

cards.name: Nature's Will
cards.text: Whenever one or more creatures you control deal combat damage to a player, tap all lands that player controls and untap all lands you control.
cards.flavor:
"Without the kami to speak to nature on our behalf, we must beg help from nature directly."
—Seshiro the Anointed

rulings.text: The lands are tapped and untapped once each time combat damage is dealt (usually once each turn, but first strike, double strike, and multiple combat phases can change that), not once for each creature that deals combat damage.

cards.originalText: Whenever one or more creatures you control deal combat damage to a player, tap all lands that player controls and untap all lands you control.

cards.name: Orbweaver Kumo
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, Orbweaver Kumo gains forestwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.originalText:
Orbweaver Kumo may block as though it had flying.
Whenever you play a Spirit or Arcane spell, Orbweaver Kumo gains forestwalk until end of turn.

cards.name: Order of the Sacred Bell
cards.flavor: "Our bodies are weak compared to those of the kami, our knowledge limited, and our magic poor. Yet we draw breath. That alone is reason to hope."

cards.name: Orochi Eggwatcher
cards.text: {2}{G}, {T}: Create a 1/1 green Snake creature token. If you control ten or more creatures, flip Orochi Eggwatcher.
cards.originalText: {2}{G}, {T}: Put a 1/1 green Snake creature token into play. If you control ten or more creatures, flip Orochi Eggwatcher.

cards.name: Shidako, Broodmistress
cards.text: {G}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {2}{G}, {T}: Put a 1/1 green Snake creature token into play. If you control ten or more creatures, flip Orochi Eggwatcher.

cards.name: Orochi Leafcaller
cards.text: {G}: Add one mana of any color.
cards.flavor: "Only orochi hatched from eggs 'touched by the kami' may become shamans. These days, there are fewer and fewer new shamans being born."
cards.originalText: {G}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Orochi Ranger
cards.text: Whenever Orochi Ranger deals combat damage to a creature, tap that creature and it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
cards.flavor:
"The young come to me, confused. They have been taught to respect the kami, and now they must fight them? I do not know what to say."
—Sachi, to her father
cards.originalText: Whenever Orochi Ranger deals combat damage to a creature, tap that creature and it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.name: Orochi Sustainer
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}.
cards.flavor: "Nothing is the same anymore. The forests are not as lush, the waters not as pure, the air not as clear. Without the kami to direct and sustain the forces of nature, it's only a matter of time before we feel their neglect."
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Rootrunner
cards.text:
{G}{G}, Sacrifice Rootrunner: Put target land on top of its owner's library.
Soulshift 3 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)
cards.originalText:
{G}{G}, Sacrifice Rootrunner: Put target land on the top of its owner's library.
Soulshift 3 (When this is put into a graveyard from play, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

cards.name: Sachi, Daughter of Seshiro
cards.text:
Other Snake creatures you control get +0/+1.
Shamans you control have "{T}: Add {G}{G}."
cards.flavor: "The warriors deal in poison and fangs. We shamans remember why our ancestors crawled with their bellies to the earth."
cards.originalText:
Other Snakes you control get +0/+1.
Shamans you control have "{T}: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool."

cards.name: Sakura-Tribe Elder
cards.text: Sacrifice Sakura-Tribe Elder: Search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: There were no tombstones in orochi territory. Slain warriors were buried with a tree sapling, so they would become a part of the forest after death.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Sakura-Tribe Elder: Search your library for a basic land card, put that card into play tapped, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Serpent Skin
cards.text:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature.
cards.originalText:
You may play Serpent Skin any time you could play an instant.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature.

cards.name: Seshiro the Anointed
cards.text:
Other Snake creatures you control get +2/+2.
Whenever a Snake you control deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: His family was the first to reach out to the human monks. He soon knew as many koans as he did blade strikes.
cards.originalText:
Other Snakes you control get +2/+2.
Whenever a Snake you control deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Shisato, Whispering Hunter
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a Snake.
Whenever Shisato, Whispering Hunter deals combat damage to a player, that player skips their next untap step.
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a Snake.
Whenever Shisato, Whispering Hunter deals combat damage to a player, that player skips his or her next untap step.

cards.name: Soilshaper
cards.text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, target land becomes a 3/3 creature until end of turn. It's still a land.
cards.flavor: It spoke with the voice of nature, but its words were curses spat upon humankind.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: Whenever you play a Spirit or Arcane spell, target land becomes a 3/3 creature until end of turn. It's still a land.

cards.name: Sosuke, Son of Seshiro
cards.text:
Other Snake creatures you control get +1/+0.
Whenever a Warrior you control deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
cards.originalText:
Other Snakes you control get +1/+0.
Whenever a Warrior you control deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

cards.name: Strength of Cedars
cards.text: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of lands you control.
cards.flavor:
"No sooner had the beast collapsed under the blows of Takeno's sword than the earth rippled and the creature rose again to face him."
—Battle of Akagi River: A Survivor's Tale
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of lands you control.

cards.name: Thousand-legged Kami
cards.text: Soulshift 7 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 7 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)
cards.originalText: Soulshift 7 (When this is put into a graveyard from play, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 7 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

cards.name: Time of Need
cards.text: Search your library for a legendary creature card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor:
"When the kumo attacked the monks' sacred shrine, a mournful toll for help echoed through the forest. Thus began the Battle of Silk, which would last six years."
—Great Battles of Kamigawa
cards.originalText: Search your library for a legendary creature card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Venerable Kumo
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Soulshift 4 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 4 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)
cards.originalText:
Venerable Kumo may block as though it had flying.
Soulshift 4 (When this is put into a graveyard from play, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 4 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

cards.name: Vine Kami
cards.text:
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Soulshift 6 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 6 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)
cards.originalText:
Vine Kami can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.
Soulshift 6 (When this is put into a graveyard from play, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 6 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

cards.name: Wear Away
cards.text:
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
Splice onto Arcane {3}{G} (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

rulings.text: You reveal all cards you intend to splice at the same time. Each individual card can be spliced only once onto any one spell.
A card with a splice ability can't be spliced onto itself because the spell is on the stack (and not in your hand) when you reveal the cards you want to splice onto it.

You choose all targets for the spell after revealing cards you want to splice, including any targets required by the text of any of those cards. You may choose a different target for each instance of the word "target" on the resulting spell.
If all of the spell's targets are illegal when the spell tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen.

cards.originalText:
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
Splice onto Arcane {3}{G} (As you play an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

cards.name: General's Kabuto
cards.text:
Equipped creature has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to equipped creature.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
cards.originalText:
Equipped creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to equipped creature.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Hair-Strung Koto
cards.text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Target player puts the top card of their library into their graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"The Kami War drove many members of Konda's court insane. As their spiritual world turned against them, so too did their minds turn from reality."
—The History of Kamigawa
cards.originalText: Tap an untapped creature you control: Target player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Hankyu
cards.text:
Equipped creature has "{T}: Put an aim counter on Hankyu" and "{T}, Remove all aim counters from Hankyu: This creature deals damage to any target equal to the number of aim counters removed this way."
Equip {4} ({4}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
cards.originalText:
Equipped creature has "{T}: Put an aim counter on Hankyu" and "{T}, Remove all aim counters from Hankyu: This creature deals damage to target creature or player equal to the number of aim counters removed."
Equip {4} ({4}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Honor-Worn Shaku
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
Tap an untapped legendary permanent you control: Untap Honor-Worn Shaku.
cards.flavor: Before being presented to its lord, each shaku is blessed by every hero of every region within that lord's domain.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
Tap an untapped legendary permanent you control: Untap Honor-Worn Shaku.

cards.name: Imi Statue
cards.text: Players can't untap more than one artifact during their untap steps.
cards.flavor:
"Just looking at it fills me with dread . . . . Yet since it arrived, I've done little else. My blades have dulled and my business has failed, and still I cannot look away."
—Keisaku, master swordmaker
cards.originalText: Players can't untap more than one artifact during their untap steps.

cards.name: Jade Idol
cards.text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, Jade Idol becomes a 4/4 Spirit artifact creature until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Before the Kami War, the shishi were symbolic guardians, protecting the shrines where they stood. But after the kami turned on the material world, shishi began pouncing from their perches to attack would-be supplicants.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: Whenever you play a Spirit or Arcane spell, Jade Idol becomes a 4/4 Spirit artifact creature until end of turn.

cards.name: Journeyer's Kite
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor:
"From the clouds, you can see as far as the distant horizon. It's a reminder of the infinite possibilities of everyday life."
—Noboru, master kitemaker
cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Junkyo Bell
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have target creature you control get +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of creatures you control. If you do, sacrifice that creature at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have target creature you control get +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of creatures you control. If you do, sacrifice that creature at end of turn.

cards.name: Konda's Banner
cards.text:
Konda's Banner can be attached only to a legendary creature.
Creatures that share a color with equipped creature get +1/+1.
Creatures that share a creature type with equipped creature get +1/+1.
Equip {2}

rulings.text: A creature can't get more than +2/+2 from Konda's Banner. Sharing more than one color or more than one creature type with the equipped creature does nothing.
The equipped creature shares a color with itself, as long as it has one or more colors.
The equipped creature shares a creature type with itself, as long as it has one or more creature types. "Artifact" is not a creature type.

cards.originalText:
Konda's Banner can be attached only to a legendary creature.
Creatures that share a color with equipped creature get +1/+1.
Creatures that share a creature type with equipped creature get +1/+1.
Equip {2}

cards.name: Kusari-Gama
cards.text:
Equipped creature has "{2}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."
Whenever equipped creature deals damage to a blocking creature, Kusari-Gama deals that much damage to each other creature defending player controls.
Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
cards.originalText:
Equipped creature has "{2}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."
Whenever equipped creature deals damage to a blocking creature, Kusari-Gama deals that much damage to each other creature defending player controls.
Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Long-Forgotten Gohei
cards.text:
Arcane spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Spirit creatures you control get +1/+1.
cards.flavor: Long ago, the priests would wave the gohei to call down the gods. Now it lies forgotten, but the spirits still feel its pull.

rulings.text: The cost reduction applies to the total cost of the Arcane spell, including any additional costs from cards spliced onto it. However, the cost reduction applies only once to each Arcane spell. For example, if you cast an Arcane spell with mana cost {R} and splice onto it a card whose splice cost is {1}{U}, then the spell costs {U}{R} to cast. If you cast an Arcane spell with mana cost {4}{U} and splice onto it a card whose splice cost is {1}{R}, the spell costs {4}{U}{R} to cast.

cards.originalText:
Arcane spells you play cost {1} less to play.
Spirits you control get +1/+1.

cards.name: Moonring Mirror
cards.text:
Whenever you draw a card, exile the top card of your library face down.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exile all cards from your hand face down. If you do, put all other cards you own exiled with Moonring Mirror into your hand.

rulings.text: Note that Moonring Mirror's first ability is not a replacement effect.
If you choose to use Moonring Mirror's second ability, you return all the cards you own exiled by both of its abilities, but not any of the cards you just exiled from your hand.

cards.originalText:
Whenever you draw a card, remove the top card of your library from the game face down.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove your hand from the game face down. If you do, put into your hand all other cards you own removed from the game with Moonring Mirror.

cards.name: Nine-Ringed Bo
cards.text: {T}: Nine-Ringed Bo deals 1 damage to target Spirit creature. If that creature would die this turn, exile it instead.
cards.flavor:
"We received an anonymous letter suggesting that Kumano holds a secret to defeating the kami, but he is nowhere to be found."
—General Takeno, letter to Lord Konda

rulings.text: The damaged creature will be exiled even if Nine-Ringed Bo isn't on the battlefield when that creature would be put into a graveyard.

cards.originalText: {T}: Nine-Ringed Bo deals 1 damage to target Spirit. If that creature would be put into a graveyard this turn, remove it from the game instead.

cards.name: No-Dachi
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +2/+0 and has first strike.
Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
cards.flavor: Not keen-edged enough for cutting armor, the no-dachi slew by folding its victim rapidly and violently under the weight of its impact.
cards.originalText:
Equipped creature gets +2/+0 and has first strike.
Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Oathkeeper, Takeno's Daisho
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +3/+1.
Whenever equipped creature dies, return that card to the battlefield under your control if it's a Samurai card.
When Oathkeeper, Takeno's Daisho is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, exile equipped creature.
Equip {2}

rulings.text: Oathkeeper's second ability checks whether the card's creature type is Samurai, not whether the creature was a Samurai when it left the battlefield.

foreignNames.name: Detentora do Juramento, Daisho de Takeno
Guardián de promesas, daisho de Takeno

cards.originalText:
Equipped creature gets +3/+1.
Whenever equipped creature is put into a graveyard from play, return that card to play under your control if it's a Samurai.
When Oathkeeper, Takeno's Daisho is put into a graveyard from play, remove equipped creature from the game.
Equip {2}

cards.name: Orochi Hatchery
cards.text:
Orochi Hatchery enters the battlefield with X charge counters on it.
{5}, {T}: Create a 1/1 green Snake creature token for each charge counter on Orochi Hatchery.
cards.originalText:
Orochi Hatchery comes into play with X charge counters on it.
{5}, {T}: Put a 1/1 green Snake creature token into play for each charge counter on Orochi Hatchery.

cards.name: Reito Lantern
cards.text: {3}: Put target card from a graveyard on the bottom of its owner's library.
cards.flavor: Lanterns carved from the mystic stones of the Reito Mines were said to light the way of lost souls.
cards.originalText: {3}: Put target card in a graveyard on the bottom of its owner's library.

cards.name: Sensei's Divining Top
cards.text:
{1}: Look at the top three cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
{T}: Draw a card, then put Sensei's Divining Top on top of its owner's library.

rulings.text: Sensei's Divining Top's second ability may be activated in response to its first ability. If so, you'll draw a card, put Sensei's Divining Top on top of your library, and then look at the top three cards and rearrange them.
If Sensei's Divining Top leaves the battlefield while its second ability is on the stack, you'll draw a card and leave Sensei's Divining Top in the zone it's moved to.

cards.originalText:
{1}: Look at the top three cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
{T}: Draw a card, then put Sensei's Divining Top on top of its owner's library.

cards.name: Shell of the Last Kappa
cards.text:
{3}, {T}: Exile target instant or sorcery spell that targets you. (The spell has no effect.)
{3}, {T}, Sacrifice Shell of the Last Kappa: You may cast a card exiled with Shell of the Last Kappa without paying its mana cost.

rulings.text: Shell of the Last Kappa's first ability can only target a spell that targets you.
Exiling a spell prevents that spell from resolving, but it doesn't technically "counter" anything. This means that Shell of the Last Kappa can exile spells which "can't be countered."

cards.originalText:
{3}, {T}: Remove from the game target instant or sorcery spell that targets you. (The spell has no effect.)
{3}, {T}, Sacrifice Shell of the Last Kappa: You may play a card removed from the game with Shell of the Last Kappa without paying its mana cost.

cards.name: Tatsumasa, the Dragon's Fang
Tenza, Godo's Maul
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1. As long as it's legendary, it gets an additional +2/+2. As long as it's red, it has trample.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
cards.originalText:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1. As long as it's legendary, it gets an additional +2/+2. As long as it's red, it has trample.
Equip {1} ({1}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Uba Mask
cards.text:
If a player would draw a card, that player exiles that card face up instead.
Each player may play cards they exiled with Uba Mask this turn.

rulings.text: You can't play cards you exiled with Uba Mask on previous turns.
Any cards you don't play just remain exiled when the turn ends.

cards.originalText:
If a player would draw a card, that player removes that card from the game face up instead.
Each player may play cards he or she removed from the game with Uba Mask this turn.

cards.name: Boseiju, Who Shelters All
cards.text:
Boseiju, Who Shelters All enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}, Pay 2 life: Add {C}. If that mana is spent on an instant or sorcery spell, that spell can't be countered.

rulings.text: The spell can't be countered if the mana produced by Boseiju is spent to cover any cost of the spell, even an additional cost such as a splice cost. This is true even if you pay an additional cost while casting a spell "without paying its mana cost."
Suppose mana produced by Boseiju is spent on a spell and an effect creates a copy of that spell. The copy can be countered, even though the original can't.

foreignNames.name: すべてを護るもの、母聖樹
Boseiju, la que cobija a todos

cards.originalText:
Boseiju, Who Shelters All comes into play tapped.
{T}, Pay 2 life: Add {1} to your mana pool. If that mana is spent on an instant or sorcery spell, that spell can't be countered by spells or abilities.

cards.name: Cloudcrest Lake
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}: Add {W} or {U}. Cloudcrest Lake doesn't untap during your next untap step.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool. Cloudcrest Lake doesn't untap during your next untap step.

cards.name: Eiganjo Castle
cards.text:
{T}: Add {W}.
{W}, {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target legendary creature this turn.
cards.flavor: Since the war began, the castle's walls mark the only place on Kamigawa where no kami has ever set foot.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
{W}, {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target legendary creature this turn.
